titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Oversize Ms. Codex 1428: Ledger of Davanzati accounts

notesStmt.note: For another manuscript probably belonging to Francesco Davanzati, see Ms. Codex 1429, Rare Book & Manuscript Library, University of Pennsylvania.
Forms part of: Gondi-Medici Business Records.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Ledger of accounts of Francesco Davanzati for the years 1555-1560. Often includes the nature of a given transaction and the counterparts involved. Most of the expenses that appear in the ledger are related to household management (purchase of food, drink, furniture and linen) or to the payment of the wages of employees of Francesco Davanzati (including carpenters, builders and farmers). Revenues are mostly related to the sale of wheat, grains and wood produced in the Davanzati estate. Small debts and credits with private individuals who are not members of any famous family appear throughout the ledger.

supportDesc.extent: 160 leaves : 328 x 228 mm. bound to 340 x 230 mm. +
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, 160; 1-121, 121-159; contemporary foliation in ink, upper right recto (f. 87-120 blank).

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 2 columns with vertical bounding lines in lead; the large column on the left with the name of the counterpart and a brief description of the transaction and the small one on the right with the amount of the transaction. Sometimes long lines are also used.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a cursive script, perhaps by multiple hands.

binding.p: Contemporary vellum; the heading Entrata e uscita, no. 223 and letter A with decorative penwork on upper cover; lower cover wraps around upper cover with remnants of leather ties; decorative leatherwork on spine.
